We will take one day to locate problem in next week. All of PPMC members are busy in SkyWalking 6-alpha or nodejs agent. In this near one month, you should have time to try to fix the problem.

Anyway, we plan to do in next week.
@ylywyn Need you to work with @ascrutae . His thoughts are reasonable.
I think this issue is caused by, you have remove all data in ElasticSearch, but don't remove the buffer files(in `/buffer` folder).
I think better way to solve this is fixing the NPE in Tomcat plugin. What do you think?
Or fix this in log exception?
Also, look like ci fails

Coverage remained the same at 24.729% when pulling **dd7a0f71b6d33f119f1b4ec5ee58da9b988f6dd5 on RC-changelog** into **d9384cdd82de2547e4d55007e03ce50707c16fad on master**.
You upgrade backend, ElasticSearch should be reset. You could remove data folder.
Replace #1559 . @ascrutae Look like the field is possible NULL. Please recheck.

yes,   this is not the root cause about #1549.   context has been removed before  AbstractMethodInterceptor::afterMethod. 

callstack like this:  
6: InvokeForRequestInterceptor::afterMethod  

5: AbstractMethodInterceptor::afterMethod        context[] is null . ContextManager.stopSpan() can't be call       
4: AbstractMethodInterceptor::beforeMethod         

3: InvokeForRequestInterceptor::afterMethod      context[SW_REQUEST]  ->   context[]   
2: InvokeForRequestInterceptor::beforeMethod     context[SW_REQUEST, SW_RESPONSE]  ->   context[SW_REQUEST, SW_RESPONSE]  

1: InvokeForRequestInterceptor::beforeMethod     context[SW_REQUEST]  ->   context[SW_REQUEST, SW_RESPONSE]

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/18564093/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/18564093)

Coverage decreased (-0.004%) to 24.682% when pulling **cacc09f87c79feff84f69a87d5c946d2c066af69 on IanCao:bug_fix** into **a29a8d7c09641b7c4e722d03c9816d15d68855c4 on apache:master**.
RUNTIME_CONTEXT management (put and remove) seems to have some problems.

I know it, @ylywyn  just remove the clear `RuntimeContext` code in `InvokeForRequestInterceptor#afterMethod `.  Don't worry about leak memory cause by `RuntimeContext`, it will clear in `AbstractMethodInterceptor#afterMethod`.
Why do you want us to release 6.0? It is a very new version, just open to contributors or feature discussion.

Moving ContextManager.stopSpan() to finally{} can solve my problem. 
I am not a Java (Spring) developer, so I am not sure that this method AbstractMethodInterceptor::afterMethod will definitely be called under any conditions.
or: When are you releasing a new version v5.x.x.RELEASE, not beta or snapshot (stable version)?
Rc will release in this week or next. Beta2 is stable enough for me.
No. But we are welcome the contribution. Add a new plugin shouldn't be too hard
The 5.0.0-RC will release in this weekend. I hope that this issue will be fixed in this issue , And could you update this PR? @ylywyn

Currently Skywalking doesn't support the lambda express class match. So the RocketMQ consumer is not in effect .  Maybe you can't use lambda express in this version. 

I will try to fix the issue  in next version.
Could you give me the demo to reproduce this issue?
Look like possible as same as the Spring one?
I already added in branch 6.0

@ascrutae   I can't provide demo now. Because it's been too long.@wu-sheng  i think so.

> Currently Skywalking doesn't support the lambda express class match. So the RocketMQ consumer is not in effect . Maybe you can't use lambda express in this version.

Is lambda expression using another API?
Maybe, I'm not sure. this question need to investigate.  I will post the result to this after I finish it .

> Maybe, I'm not sure. this question need to investigate. I will post the result to this after I finish it .

OK. I am OK to fix this in the next iteration.

> The 5.0.0-RC will release in this weekend. I hope that this issue will be fixed in this issue , And could you update this PR? @ylywyn

@ascrutae Consider sending a separated PR to fix this? I will keep this PR open in next 24 hours, in case @ylywyn still has interested in the update.

I just know someone in the community is using molten as codebases, wants to switch it to SkyWalking core. But I am not sure whether it is done or open sourced.

Let's keep this issue open.

Coverage remained the same at 24.686% when pulling **59584a1c3b0b5e7fb3ddd364be6f36b49c841316 on ascrutae:fix/spring-runtimcontext-issue** into **513b8d689bdb641c1355582f37b9e460a595e125 on apache:master**.
Relate to #1549
#1568 provided a better solution to fix this. @ylywyn still thanks for helping.
Look like as same as #1549 . Closing for now. If this still stays, reopen a new one, and provide us a demo to reproduce. Thanks @xyydcoo
Self-reference can't be supported in the first layout of topology. @hanahmily will try to disable the first layout in this scenario.
Do your RPC client do async request? We found a bug that service reference fails when a segment has no entry span.

Yes, I am currently developing a php agent based on the secondary development of open source molten, which is used to collect data reported to skywalking. The current progress has been completed for tracking single process links, and is currently under development for cross-process. 
When I finish this part of the development I will open it up.

ps: it supports php5 and php7.1 versions.
@tincopper Thanks for sharing this with us. You could ping @zzusoftboy after you open sourced the project. He is good at C and PHP both.
See #1567 . I hope molten's SkyWalking version could be open sourced and released soon. FYI @tincopper you will have several funs.
Considering this PR includes source codes, let us figure about the License things.

@michaelsembwever @WillemJiang Do you have experience about using `gradlew` or `mvnw` in Apache repository?

Maven wrapper(shell and cmd) is already under ASF Licensed.

- https://github.com/bdemers/maven-wrapper
- https://github.com/takari/maven-wrapper/
Nicely done. Welcome and thank for your feedback. Highly likely fix #1468 as well.
FYI @peng-yongsheng

Nope, just simple FeginClient request.
Have performance concern. Don't fix even it is a potential bug now.
Could you try the master branch codes? I didn't find any other issues. And no one reports to us.

There has some configuration item which install [ojdbc jar](https://github.com/adriancole/incubator-skywalking/blob/mvn-wrapper/pom.xml#L450) and [resin jar](https://github.com/adriancole/incubator-skywalking/blob/mvn-wrapper/pom.xml#L450) in `pom.xml`, Is there execute command need to change to `./mvnw` command?

BTW, I found that I execute `./mvnw install` command  with error message and execute `./mvnw install -Dmaven.test.skip` without error message in my local environment, Is there same problem in your environment, if not, I will recheck my environment. Here is the error logs:
```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test (default-test) on project apm-util: Execution default-test of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test failed.: NullPointerException -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test (default-test) on project apm-util: Execution default-test of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test failed.
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute (MojoExecutor.java:213)
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute (MojoExecutor.java:154)
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute (MojoExecutor.java:146)
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject (LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:117)
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject (LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:81)
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.builder.singlethreaded.SingleThreadedBuilder.build (SingleThreadedBuilder.java:56)
    at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleStarter.execute (LifecycleStarter.java:128)
....
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.shade.org.apache.commons.lang3.SystemUtils.isJavaVersionAtLeast (SystemUtils.java:1626)
    at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.getEffectiveJvm (AbstractSurefireMojo.java:2107)
    at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.getForkConfiguration (AbstractSurefireMojo.java:1976)
    at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.executeProvider (AbstractSurefireMojo.java:1111)
    at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.executeAfterPreconditionsChecked (AbstractSurefireMojo.java:954)
    at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.execute (AbstractSurefireMojo.java:832)
    at org.apache.maven.plugin.DefaultBuildPluginManager.executeMojo (DefaultBuildPluginManager.java:137)
```

Update compile JDK version? To 9 or 10?

summary is that updating the versions here is a good thing because the maven version bundled has newer versions than what the pom currently pins. Best way to have smooth is to have versions set to same or more recent version.. might not be behind the error, but easy way to rule out problems

also need go agent！
our company use java php go python~
Go auto instrument agent is too hard for me. I think i am not the right one to do so. The SkyWalking go sdk is not finished. If there is any volunteer to offer helps, it can continue.

I mean, if update jdk requirement, we need to change compile and install document. Update maven plugin version, should be fine.

Could you help on the update?

I just test it in jdk10 and it still failed. I just look the `maven-wrapper.properties` file and it show the maven version is `3.5.4` and the version works fine in my local environment is `3.3.9`, Are you mean that the plugin version is bit old by using `3.5.4` and you want to upgrade the plugin version ?

This pull request just moves to maven wrapper (and bumps common plugin versions). I setup maven enforcer to fail fast on JDK > 1.8 because other work needs to happen to support later versions.

The task of stabilizing maven is different than the task of using latest java, even if this task will help make using recent java easier. Make sense?

PS there are other plugins that need refactoring.. I noticed some copy paste around things like grpc. I don't have time to investigate each of these, but at least getting the standard plugins in shape is hopefully helpful.
net down 450+ lines :) I think we paid for the shell scripts heh
FYI I mentioned on gitter, but I'm not planning to do more work on this PR. Some other day I might help with JDK 10, but I have other things to work on today. Cheers!
just rebased as I noticed master moved. this invalidated prior approvals @wu-sheng @michaelsembwever

It seems it's to large to post to you. But you can download it from here  http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/features/jdbc/jdbc-ucp-122-3110062.html

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/18604149/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/18604149)

Coverage remained the same at 24.68% when pulling **1c993fa7b0d226137213b977fb838336b250983f on IanCao:master** into **46c0e76ef943ab4a4b89ec315a006107e069d54d on apache:master**.
We don't know :)  You can run some tests on your own env. I guess it is yes.

on 5.0.0-beta2 ,when i set agent.namespace=xx and configuration.default.namespace= xxx or configuration.default.namespace= xxx-sw3,there are same error,like this:
org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.analysis.worker.model.impl.MergePersistenceWorker -81698 [pool-2-thread-1] ERROR [] - Received an instance heart beat message under instance id= 11 , which doesn't exist.
Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2018/8/oatiz/testReport-master-2018-08-22-17-51.md).

Yes, it did.

I checked code from motan1.1.0-1.1.1 to skywalking-3.2.6.
Then I think the key is : the process of these classes is same in motan that from 1.1.0 to 1.1.1 as below:

private static final String ENHANCE_CLASS = "com.weibo.api.motan.transport.ProviderMessageRouter";
private static final String ENHANCE_CLASS = "com.weibo.api.motan.rpc.AbstractReferer";

So it works, is this reason? Of course , I had run on my own env, it did work.

BTW, the java classes named in skywalking is some weird, I mean,
MotanProviderInstrumentation-->com.weibo.api.motan.rpc.AbstractReferer
MotanConsumerInstrumentation-->com.weibo.api.motan.transport.ProviderMessageRouter
It seems named reverse.
Yes. That is the reason. @ascrutae could you confirm whether the naming is wrong?
Yes. the class name is incorrect. Maybe you can send an PR to resolve this problem. @hepyu
I will keep this open, someone may be interested in contributing to this plugin. I look forward to that.
@hepyu Please help us to fix this in 5.0(master branch)

Even no functional issue, naming is making people confused. Need to be fixed in RC release.
we should re-add `.mvn/wrapper/MavenWrapperDownloader.java` as some people don't have wget installed and it will cause support problems.
I will raise a PR
If no wget, this java file will be compiled and run by script. Right?

yep

SkyWalking 6 will do more and make alert more convenient.
Which dubbo version?
1.0.1.0, but i still can not understand why.....  there is no error log in beforeMethod and the span should  be put into threadLocal.
Dubbo 1.0? Really have this version?

At most scenarios, our Tomcat plugin works well. If you are facing NPE, we need your detail info:
1. Tomcat version
1. Your application code skeleton or demo, which could trigger this NPE.
im sorry.. the dubbo version is 2.5.4 ... the 1.0.1.0 is a private packaged dubbo based on 2.5.4 ......

Dubbo 2.5.4 passed from our automatically daily test report. You can find it here: https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report#dubbo All cases are open sourced too, https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases/tree/master/dubbo-scenario

You need to provide more things, I suggest you compare your codes with our cases, may find a clue?
ok  i'll find more info to solve this NPE
I will try to sync, to see whether this is fixed.
